body.p: Select the letter representing the progenitor of the phagocytic white blood cells.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The common myeloid gives rise to the white blood cells and the red blood cells.
Incorrect. The common lymphoid progenitor gives rise to white blood cells that play a role in specific immune response.
Correct. The myeloblasts give rise to the white blood cells such as the neutrophils and macrophages, which are phagocytic.
Incorrect. The megakaryocytes give rise to the platelets or thrombocytes.
Incorrect. Macrophages are not progenitor cells, they are phagocytic cells.

part.hint: The phagocytic white blood cells have the same progenitor cell as the basophophils which release heparin.

body.p: Select the letter representing the progenitor cell that will give rise to cells that will provide specific immune response.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The common myeloid gives rise to the white blood cells and the red blood cells, which are not involved in specific immune response.
Correct. The common lymphoid progenitor gives rise to white blood cells that play a role in specific immune response.
Incorrect. The myeloblasts give rise to the white blood cells such as the neutrophils and macrophages, which are phagocytic.
Incorrect. The megakaryocytes give rise to the platelets or thrombocytes.
Incorrect. Macrophages are not progenitor cells they are phagocytic cells.

part.hint: These cells are a type of white blood cell.
These cells are often found in the lymph as well as the blood.

body.p: Select the letter representing the progenitor cell that gives rise to the largest variety of blood cells.

response.feedback: Correct. The common myeloid gives rise to the megakaryocytes, mast cells, white blood cells and the red blood cells.
Incorrect. The common lymphoid progenitor gives rise to just the natural killer cells and B and T lymphocytes.
Incorrect. The myeloblasts give rise to the white blood cells such as the neutrophils and macrophages, which are phagocytic.
Incorrect. The megakaryocytes give rise to the platelets or thrombocytes.
Incorrect. Macrophages are not progenitor cells, they are phagocytic cells.

part.hint: It gives rise to all three types of formed elements in the blood.
